com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell

Class InputStreamSink

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.InputStreamSink

  • public final class InputStreamSink
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides sinks for input streams. Continuously read an input stream until the end-of-file is encountered. The stream may be redirected to an OutputStream, or discarded.

    This class is useful for handing the stdout and stderr streams from a Process started with Runtime.exec(String). If these streams are not consumed, the Process may block resulting in a deadlock.

    See Also:
    JavaWorld: When Runtime.exec() won't

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.Runnable newRunnableSink(java.io.InputStream in)
      Creates a Runnable which consumes the provided InputStream 'in', discarding its contents.
      static java.lang.Runnable newRunnableSink(java.io.InputStream in, java.io.OutputStream out)
      Creates a Runnable which copies everything from 'in' to 'out'.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • newRunnableSink

        public static java.lang.Runnable newRunnableSink(java.io.InputStream in)
        Creates a Runnable which consumes the provided InputStream 'in', discarding its contents.

      • newRunnableSink

        public static java.lang.Runnable newRunnableSink(java.io.InputStream in,
                                                 java.io.OutputStream out)
        Creates a Runnable which copies everything from 'in' to 'out'. 'out' will be written to and flushed after each read from 'in'. However, 'out' will not be closed.
